kapampangan: : Mayap a abak! Yaku pu y Joaquin, maswelu kung mikit ikit tamu kening pamiyabe yabe ning kekatang balayan.,Good morning!
english: My name is Joaquin, and I’m very pleased to meet you today at this wonderful community gathering.

kapampangan: : Kumusta! Pakilala ke , ing sarili ku kekayu ngan . Yaku ing bayung nyug siping bale. Maralas yu nakung akit kanyan
english: Hello there! I’m new to the neighborhood and just wanted to introduce myself to everyone I might see regularly.

kapampangan: : Maralas tutu pin magalang patse babati kang mayap a gatpanapun balang lulungub ka king metung a kwartu o patse atin kang akilalang bayung tau.
english: It’s always polite to say good afternoon when you walk into a room or meet someone for the first time.

kapampangan: : King kekaming kultura, metung yang maralas miyang gagawan ing babati ampong makipag galamanu, lakwasna patse magpakilala o atin miting.
english: In our culture, a handshake is a common way to greet someone, especially during formal introductions or meetings.

kapampangan: : Patse akasalubung me ing metung a tau king mumunang besis, masanting nung mayli ka, pong lumawe ka king mata da, at kutnangan me kung komusta ne ing aldo na
english: When you meet someone for the first time, it’s nice to smile, make eye contact, and ask how their day has been.

kapampangan: : Matula kung akilala da na ka! marakal kung dimdam kareng obra mu ampong nung makananu ka sumaup kareng aliwang tau.
english: I’m glad to finally meet you! I’ve heard so much about your work and how helpful you are to others.

kapampangan: : Maralas kung sasabyan ing “komusta naka?” o “mipakananu naka” ban apakit ing lingap ampo kaburyanan king metung a tau.
english: I usually say “How are you?” or “How have you been?” to express care and interest in someone’s well-being.

kapampangan: : Patse atin kung bisita, batian kulang tambing king pasbul pamu ampong didinan ku lang inuman o pamangan.
english: Whenever I have guests, I greet them warmly at the door and offer them something to drink or eat.

kapampangan: : Ing pamaniabing “dakal a salamat” kaybat ning pamagpakilala, mag silbi yang pamanantabe a maglakwang masangting a bage kareng tawung akayabe tamu
english: Saying “thank you” after an introduction shows appreciation, and it leaves a good impression on the people I just met.

kapampangan: : Kaugalian keng pamilya ku ing mipagbati la keng metung at metung kayabe ing metung a kawul ampo ing maganakang tapik king gulut potang miras nala king bale.
english: It’s customary in my family to greet each other with a hug or a gentle pat on the back when arriving home.

kapampangan: : Patse pakilala ke ing sarili ku king pamagtupun, importanteng masalese keng sabyan ing lagyu ku ampong mamyeng makuyad a bage patungkul king kakung papil ampong sarya ku.
english: When introducing myself in a meeting, it's important to clearly say my name and briefly explain my role or purpose.

kapampangan: : king iskwela, balang abak magpraktis ku nung pakananu kula batian reng kanakung talaturu bangkanita bangkanita apakit ku ing pamagresputu karela at impusan ing aldo na masaya
english: At school, I practice greeting my teachers every morning as a way of showing respect and starting the day positively.

kapampangan: : Patse akalingwan ke ing lagyu na ning metung a tau kayari kulang akilala, masanting nung kutnangan mulang pasibayu bangkanita atandanan mune king tutuki
english: If I forget someone’s name after meeting them, it’s okay to ask again politely and try to remember it next time.

kapampangan: :king propesyunal a bage naman, iisipan kuna mas masanting siguru nung gumamit tamung pormal a pamagbati kalupa naning “Mayap a abak , Sir” o kaya naman ‘Mayap a gatpapun, Ma’am”
english: In professional settings, I think it’s better to use formal greetings like “Good morning, Sir” or “Good afternoon, Ma’am.”

kapampangan: :Maralas tuturu da kanaku na dukung bagya o tangu potang babati ku kareng mangatwa, lakwas na patse mikit ikit kayung mipapamilya o kaya naman patse atin okasyun.
english: I was often taught to bow slightly or nod when I greet elders, especially during family reunions or holidays.

kapampangan: : Patse mumunta ku king bale na ning kakung kaluguran, babati ku pati king kayang pengari bang ipakit ing resputu king pamilya da.
english: When I visit a friend’s house, I greet their parents as well—it shows courtesy and respect for their family.

kapampangan: : Kayari na ning masaleseng pamagkilala, maralas kung makipag palit kontak karela kalupa ning numeru king teleponu o kaya naman account kareng social media.
english: After a successful introduction, I often exchange contact information like phone numbers or social media handles.

kapampangan: : Ing pamagpakilala kareng kekang kaluguran kareng alwa, makasaup ya para mas manyaman king pakiramdam , lakwas na kareng grupu o akaya naman patse atin okasyun.
english: Introducing friends to one another helps everyone feel more comfortable, especially in group settings or social events.
